dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) Dear Walt and Icey: | bet you been worried and gave us up for lost. Took the kids down here with me for a visit to my sister Elsie's farm. Thot a little change of scenery would do us all a world of good after so much trubble and heartache. At least the kids will git a plenty of good home cooking. Your devoted Harry Powell

dialogues.text: Now ain't you relieved, Walt?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Sure, but you was worried too, Mother; takin’ off with never a word of goodbye. | even got to figurin' them gypsies busted in and done off with all three of 'em.

dialogues.text: You and your gypsies! They been gone a week!

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Not before one of 'em knifed a farmer and stole his horse. Never caught the gypsies nor the horse.

dialogues.speaker: PREACHER
dialogues.text: (continuing) ..before the eyes of God. The world is fast going to damnation because of impudent youngins a-flyin' in the face of Age. dialogues.text: (loud) You two youngsters get up here to me this instant! TWO-SHOT — JOHN AND PEARL - RACHEL'S ANGLE

dialogues.text: She has JOHN and PEARL by their napes.

dialogues.text: She holds JOHN and PEARL very firmly, inspecting baskets, across gate of fence.

dialogues.text: Nicely picked, Clary. Mary; put the big ones on top. Ruby, most o' them ain't fit to go to market. Put them baskets down. Ruby, fetch the washtub and put it by the pump. dialogues.text: (in chorus) Yes Miz Cooper! They hurry off.

dialogues.text: Come on, now; up to the house. She opens the gate, pushes the Harper children through, s the gate, and walks between them, her back to us. The chi hesitate. dialogues.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
dialogues.text: Gracious! If you hain't a sight to beat all! Where you from? No answer; their eyes are wide with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
dialogues.text: Where's your folks?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
dialogues.text: (O.s.) Speak up now! His eyes go down to her feet. He, and we, start to examin her from foot to head; for this is our heroine at last. dialogues.text: she follows WAITRESS, then LOVERS in car, with her eyes.
